column4: You guys know the linux drivers in the ubuntu wiki, can they run games okay?
you talking about the Ati or nvidia drivers?
Sorry, the Nvidia ones
yup they woikin good :). they run games, well really the card works as good as xp. the only downside it game compatability in linux :)
the ones you install direct from synaptic?
Yeah i know them, are they the ones that run okay?
yeah.
you can use the envy installer but manually works also.
I mean the drivers that are the nvidia-glx inside synaptic?
I mean the drivers that are the nvidia-glx inside synaptic?
yeah, those are the ones the guide tells you to install right?, thats what i got and it works fine
okay :)
Do you run games on them?
umm i run WoW and Steam with wine and it works really good. and i got some native linux games like Quake 3, Quake 4, NWN, Savage, RTCW Enemy territory, Tibia and a VBA emulator :D
Thats all i needed to know, thanks :)
The guide should guide to which one you should select :)
Its like do i want the non free-ones or the free ones?
now im confused :)
well you search 'linux-restricted-modules' in synaptic and look
i have the non free ones listed. although dosen't make sense :) the modules are free :)
Can you remember which ones you selected when you installed the drivers or did you not touch them?
I just installed the ones that met the specification to the uname -r im running
hows things?
